means: （人）喋喋不休( chatter的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Radical feminism is currently the fashionable topic among the chattering classes.
sentence.Network_cn: 激进的女权主义是时下名嘴阶层热议的话题。

sentence.Network_en: He listened to chattering maids as they passed by.
sentence.Network_cn: 他留神听着从身边走过的姑娘们嘴里在闲扯着什么。

sentence.Network_en: "No time for chattering now."— 'Be seeing you. then.'

entry.def: If you chatter, you talk quickly and continuously, usually about things which are not important.

example.ex: Everyone's chattering away in different languages...
example.tran: 大家操着不同的语言喋喋不休地说着。

example.ex: Erica was friendly and chattered about Andrew's children...
example.tran: 埃丽卡很和气，不停地念叨着安德鲁的孩子们。

entry.def: If your teeth chatter, they keep knocking together because you are very cold or very nervous.

example.ex: She was so cold her teeth chattered.

entry.def: If objects chatter, they make short repeated sounds.

example.ex: The telex chattered all day and night with news bulletins.
example.tran: 电传机没日没夜“嗒嗒嗒”地接收新闻稿。

entry.tran: (鸟)鸣叫，啁啾;(动物)唧唧叫，吱吱叫
entry.def: When birds or animals chatter, they make high-pitched noises.

example.tran: 鸟儿在某处唧唧喳喳地叫着。

means.word_mean: 1. the rapid series of noises made by the parts of a machine
2. the high-pitched continuing noise made by animals (birds or monkeys)
1. engaged in making a rapid repetitive noise resembling speech;

auth_sentence.content: Yoga means to still the chattering of the mind.
auth_sentence.res_content: Yoga means to still the chattering of the mind.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yoga means to still the chattering of the mind.

auth_sentence.content: The people were clotting into groups, chattering excitedly.

auth_sentence.content: He was nervous..., chattering the conventional commonplaces.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was nervous..., chattering the conventional commonplaces.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was nervous..., chattering the conventional commonplaces.
